funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by First Southwest Community Fund for the development of a marketing plan for EsoTerra Cider, a small business producing hard cider products. EsoTerra is sourcing its apples from abandoned and neglected historic orchards across Southwest Colorado, revitalizing this long dormant resource. EsoTerra estimates that the available raw commodity could provide 1% of the nations burgeoning hard cider market. The development of a marketing plan for EsoTerra is projected to allow for increased sales and expansion of their customer base thereby, driving the creation of seven new jobs.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a new vehicle for the Custer County Sheriffs Department. Located in southern Colorado, Custer County currently has two vehicles in its Sheriff Departments fleet to cover 740 square miles. One vehicle was recently totally lost and the department has limited funding resources to replace it. The all-terrain cruiser purchased with Rural Developments investment will ensure that law enforcement officials will be able to adequately respond to any incident in the county.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to replace aging wastewater piping in the town of Louviers in Northern Colo. The current system that conveys wastewater to the treatment lagoon was constructed in the early 1960s. Recent inspections identified a number of pipe deficiencies, including tree root penetrations and cracked and broken pipes present throughout the entire system. This project will replace 315 linear feet of 12-inch line to correct infiltration issues that were inflating the volume of influent to the treatment lagoon. Overall, this project will ensure that this rural community of 269 residents has reliable wastewater treatment for years to come.

funding_code: GUARANTEED B&I 3% FEE LOAN
naics_industry_sector: Accommodation and Food Services (72)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase the 44 room Days Inn hotel in Gunnison, CO. This loan will allow the entity to retain its Days Inn Flagship and hire additional employees.

funding_code: ECONOMIC IMPACT INITIATIVE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase equipment for Seasons Schoolhouse, a childcare facility in the Town of Gunnison located in the Rocky Mountains in Western Colo. There is a dire need in the community for increased childcare capacity and Seasons Schoolhouse only has the room to care for 14 preschool students. This project will renovate a recently vacated senior center building into a modern and increased-capacity childcare facility. This will help address the concerning lack of childcare seats in the area by increasing the capacity of Seasons Schoolhouse to over 50 students. In addition to the increased preschool seats, this will allow for more childcare options to parents such as infant care and after-school programing, which were not previously available. In addition, this project will create an estimated 8 new full-time jobs at the facility. Overall, this project will help address the need for childcare for the 6,141 residents of this rural community.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to for renovations and the purchase of equipment for Seasons Schoolhouse, a childcare facility in the Town of Gunnison, Colorado located in the Rocky Mountains in the western part of the state. There is a pressing need to increase childcare capacity in the Gunnison community as there is currently only space to care for 14 preschool students. The project will turn a recently vacated senior center building into a modern increased-capacity childcare facility. This renovation will increase the capacity of Seasons Schoolhouse to over 50 students. In addition to offering more preschool spaces, this investment will create more childcare options for parents including infant care and after-school programming. These programs are currently unavailable. This project will create an estimated 8 new full-time jobs and contribute to addressing the childcare needs of the 6,141 residents of this rural community.

funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Accommodation and Food Services (72)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist J&K Ventures Corp, dba La Plaza Inn, a woman-owned small business in Southern Colorado, purchase and install a 25.08 kilowatt (kW) solar array. The new system is expected to save the business $5,288 in electrical costs per year. It will also replace 37,769 kilowatt hours (kWh) per year, which is enough electricity to power three and a half homes.

naics_description: NURSERY, GARDEN CENTER, AND FARM SUPPLY STORES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist to purchase and install a 22.04 kilowatt (kWH) solar photovoltaic system at the nursery located in Durango, CO.The entity has installed a solar system on the roof of their establishment that will replace 100 percent of their energy consumption. This project will realize $4,236 per year in savings and will generate 44,556kWh (141 percent) per year, which is enough to power four homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Yoder Farms LLC, in Trinidad, Colorado purchase and install a 33-kWoc and 18-kWoc photo-voltaic solar system. Once installed, the systems will offset 87 percent to 120 percent of the farms electrical consumption. This will save the business owner money every month from a reduced electric bill and provide clean renewable energy to the facility instead of fossil fuel-based electricity.

borrower_name: SPANISH PEAKS AND BON CARBO FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT
funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a new 6X6 fire truck for the Spanish Peaks and Bon Carbo Fire Protection District. The Protection District serves an area of approximately 1,600 square miles in southern Colorado. The district currently has only one truck with the capacity to transport large quantities of water to the scene of a fire. Due to the size of the catchment area, the existing fire truck can be up to 40 miles away from where it is needed. This investment in a new tanker equipped truck will effectively cut response time in half and double the capacity of the District to fight fires. Overall, this project will help ensure that the 15,675 residents of the District are protected in the event of fire.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct an augmentation reservoir for the town of Aguilar in southern Colorado. Aguilar is currently under review from the Colorado Department of Public Health & Environment for water treatment concerns. Additionally, the town does not comply with their junior water rights due to having no way to refill depletions of their wells. This project will construct an augmentation reservoir and all associated piping and equipment designed to meet Colorados Augmentation Plan requirements and comply with their water rights and stakeholder agreements. Overall this project will ensure this rural community of 538 people has continued access to safe drinking water.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct an augmentation reservoir for the town of Aguilar in southern Colorado. Aguilar is currently under review from the Colorado Department of Public Health & Environment for water treatment concerns. Additionally, the town does not comply with their junior water rights due to having no way to refill depletions of their wells. This project will construct an augmentation reservoir and all associated piping and equipment designed to meet Colorados Augmentation Plan requirements and comply with their water rights and stakeholder agreements. Overall this project will ensure this rural community of 538 people has continued access to safe drinking water.

program: SEARCH - Special Evaluation Assistance for Rural Communities and Households Grant (WEP)
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) SEARCH GRANTS WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to fund an evaluation of water system needs for the town of Model in southern Colo. The system currently utilizes water softeners and a holding pond for filtered-out impurities. The water softeners are worn out and both the holding pond and distribution lines have leaks and infiltration issues. This project will fund a Preliminary Engineering Report and Environmental Report to determine next steps so that this rural community of 41 residents has access to clean water.

funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide additional funding for the town of Hugo in Eastern Colorado to complete their wastewater treatment plant project. The towns existing wastewater treatment system consists of two unlined lagoons that exceed effluent and are insufficient to treat current flow. This project provides the additional funding needed to complete construction of a new evaporative pond system, install a new lift station and decommission the old plant. This project will ensure that this rural community of 730 residents has safe and effective wastewater treatment.

funding_code: VALUE-ADDED PRODUCER DEVELOPMENT GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Clark Family Orchards add value to its farms fruit that often goes to waste or is sold at a very low price. The family produces about 130 acres of preaches, pears, cherries, apricots and plums. On average, depending upon the weather, they harvest 1,690 tons of fruit. The grant funds will be used to help offset the cost of launching the new on-farm distillery.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help the town of Mancos for the design and feasibility study for a community co-workspace facility. Mancos and the surrounding Mancos Valley have become a destination place for entrepreneurs and emerging micro and small businesses spilling out of the more densely populated regional communities in search of lower overhead costs and a more cohesive support system. This project will develop data sufficient to understand the costs and potential benefits of establishing and operating a community co-workspace in Mancos.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
naics_description: AMERICAN INDIAN AND ALASKA NATIVE TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will support two major business development goals of the Ute Mountain Ute tribe, by opening a much needed independent grocery store and launching food entrepreneurs for economic development in Towaoc, Colorado. Currently, there are 2,000 residents on the reservation.

funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing (53)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Solar GardenPartners 3 LLP install a 36.4 kilowatt (kW) hour solar system on the roof of the Cortez City Airport. This system will replace 69,434 kilowatts (kW) (100 percent) of their energy consumption and realize $8,123 per year. This savings is equivalent to powering six homes.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Alpacka Raft LLC install a 35.75 kilowatt (kW) solar photovoltaic system on their roof. project_name: Main Water Line to Towaoc Phase I
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) 306C-NATIVE AMERICAN-WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to replace the pipeline connecting the Ute Mountain Ute Tribal community of Towaoc to the water system of the city of Cortez in southwest Colorado. Currently, the connection is through a 22-mile ductile iron pipeline that was constructed in 1988. This pipeline has been experiencing increasing breakages and leaks, and a 2012 survey determined that the soil is too corrosive in many areas along the pipe for the protection that is installed. This project will replace approximately 13,000 feet with High Density Polyethylene pipeline that is better able to withstand the corrosive soil. It will also install additional isolation valves to reduce water loss should a break occur. Overall, this project will also allow the Ute Mountain Ute Tribe to reduce servicing on the existing corrosion protection systems, saving the community money along with ensuring the community has access to clean water for years to come.

funding_code: GUAR FOR BONDS & NOTES FOR ELEC OR TELE
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: Rural Development 313A funds will make investments in utility infrastructure loans or refinance bonds or notes issued for utility infrastructure funding purposes. CoBank is one of four banks of the Farm Credit System that was created by the U.S. Congress to fill a need for long-term agricultural credit. CoBank is cooperatively owned by its U.S. customer-owners, including agricultural cooperatives, rural energy, companies, and financial institutions that serve rural America.

funding_code: DLT GRANTS - CARES ACT - EDUCATIONAL
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to implement a distance learning system to connect Fort Lewis College to its students. Technology to support instructional delivery will be provided at four rural connectivity centers in La Plata and Conejos counties in Colorado; Apache County in Arizona, and San Juan County in New Mexico. The distance learning program will help improve academic outcomes, advance student well-being and strengthen partnerships with tribal governments and rural communities while bridging the digital divide for Fort Lewis College students.

funding_code: PILOT BROADBAND 100% GRANT- RBS REDG SUB ACCOUNT SEC. 762- GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to deploy a fiber-to-the-premises network in rural Colorado. The funded service area includes 2,410 households, 6,877 people, three educational facilities, 89 businesses and 115 farms spread over 126 square miles.

funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct a non-traditional skilled nursing facility in the City of La Junta, serving a rural community of 18,830 residents in Southeastern Colorado. The former skilled nursing facility closed in 2020, forcing the areas residents to relocate to other facilities scattered throughout Colorado. The La Junta City Council commissioned a study and determined the area could support at least a 50-bed facility. Citizens of La Junta overwhelmingly voted to form the La Junta Health Service District and authorized a sales tax to make the facility a reality. This project will construct a new Green House or hybrid skilled nursing facility called Bluestem Village. The non-traditional facility will consist of four identical, stand-alone skilled nursing units with 14 beds per unit and a fifth building to include an administrative office and attached gathering area/community center. The development of an open, suburban site will include parking, sidewalks, landscaping, courtyard and walking paths on 35 acres of previously undeveloped land. The location is both close to the City and allows for future expansion (need is expected to rise to 117 beds in the future). Overall, this project will ensure the areas residents can live in their community and provide quality, skilled nursing care to the community going forward.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct a new wastewater treatment plant for the North La Junta Sanitation District in Southeastern Colorado. The current aerated lagoon system is not appropriate for meeting discharge permit limitations and the District has received a Notice of Violation / Cease and Desist Order from the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment (CDPHE) primarily related to failure to meet effluent limitations. This project will construct a new evaporative pond system and decommission the old lagoons. This new system will include a lift station located at the site of the old plant to convey the districts wastewater to the new plant. The three evaporative ponds will be constructed with synthetic liners to limit seepage and designed so that any cell may be bypassed for maintenance. The plant will also be non-discharging, bringing them back into compliance with all CDPHE requirements and reducing the risk of future violations. Overall, this project will ensure the customers of North La Junta Sanitation District have access to wastewater treatment that meets all State requirements for years to come.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Educational Services (61)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Colorado Mountain College, along with $10,050 in college funding, provide business training and technical assistance to small businesses in Routt County, Colorado. The project is expected to make the small businesses served more effective at marketing their goods and services, resulting in increased sales and the retention and creation of jobs. The college already has commitments to provide the services to six small businesses which is expected to result in retaining eleven jobs that are at risk of being lost. The project is intended to offset some of the negative economic impacts of the reduction of coal mining, the decline in fossil fuel exploration, development and production and the upcoming closure of the electric generating station in 2028.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a vehicle for the town of Oak Creek in northwestern Colorado. Oak Creek is a small town of 884 residents and its Public Safety Department has an aging fleet which includes vehicles that have been in use for 18 years. This has made it challenging for public safety officials to respond to calls due to road conditions and inclement weather. This investment will be used to purchase an all-terrain vehicle specially equipped for these conditions, improving the speed and efficacy of their responses.

borrower_name: Morrison Creek Metro Water and Sanitation District
funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to replace the wastewater treatment plant for the Morrison Creek District which serves a community of 2,519 rural residents in Routt County within the Rocky Mountains in northern Colorado. Currently, the districts plant has exceeded its useful life, having been built in 1973, and no replacement parts are available, forcing them to rely on a local machinist to custom-make parts when repairs are necessary. The plant has no redundancy in the event of power outage, fire, or other disaster which could lead to untreated effluent being discharged into Stagecoach Reservoir, a nearby heavily-used recreational area. This project will use the existing site, but replace the plant with modern Sequencing Batch Reactor technology that will bring the plant into compliance with Colorado Department of Public Health & Environment and National Fire Protection Association standards. It will also include redundancy and the capacity to handle the areas future growth, which is expected to continue to exceed the states average.

naics_industry_sector: Educational Services (61)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide a loan guarantee to build Phase one of the dome and clubhouse for Future Legends Sports Park in Windsor, Colorado. The sports park will provide indoor/outdoor sporting facilities, on-site lodging, restaurants, and retail. The completed project is expected to create 50 new jobs as well as increase tourism to Windsor, Colorado.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a backup generator for the Town of Grover, a small community of 521 residents located in northern Colorado. The towns water storage tower only provides about two days worth of water. While the towns wastewater treatment plant has a backup generator, the water system does not. Recent power outages lasting multiple days have left the town hours away from running out of potable water and have demonstrated the necessity for a backup generator. This project will purchase a trailer-mounted generator and also perform minor renovations on the towns two water treatment facilities to allow them to connect to the generator, ensuring the towns access to potable water in the event of an emergency.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to modernize the water system of the Aristocrat Ranchettes community in northern Colorado. Currently, the system purchases water from the nearby Central Weld County Water District and does not provide raw water or water treatment. Though the system is equipped with fire hydrants, the current pipe sizes and lack of a high-service pump prevents the system from proving fire flows. The current setup also results in low pressure for users when the 270,000-gallon storage tank is being filled. Nearby "Filing #3" is served by individual wells, many of which have tested over the Maximum Contaminant Limit. This project will overhaul the system, replacing the existing storage tank with a new 350,000-gallon one, extend service Filing #3, alleviating their well issues and adding 132 potential taps to the system, replace the existing pipe with properly-sized PVC piping, add a high-service pump for fire flows, install pressure-reducing valves and modernize the system controls. Overall, this project will improve service for existing users, remedy issues experienced by incoming users and ensure this rural community of 1,344 residents has access to potable water as their community grows.

funding_code: INTERMEDIARY RELENDING PROGRAM
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
naics_description: ADMINISTRATION OF URBAN PLANNING AND COMMUNITY AND RURAL DEVELOPMENT
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide low-interest loans to private and public organizations in Rural Colorado, with a focus on Alamosa, Archuleta, Conejos, Costilla, Dolores, La Plata, Mineral, Montezuma, Rio Grande, Saguache and San Juan counties. The borrower will build upon a successful track record of intermediary micro-lending by providing access to capital and investment for those micro-borrowers with limited options. This recapitalization of their Intermediary Relending Program funds will further expand the economic development opportunities for small businesses in Rural Colorado.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install an 8.4 kilowatt (kW) Solar photovoltaic roof mounted, grid tied system that will generate 112,372 kilowatt hours (kWh) of energy. This is enough energy to power approximately 11 homes, and is 230 percent of the historical energy consumption of the agricultural business.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide immediate relief from the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic for the Food Bank Network operated by La Puenta Home, Inc., a non-profit in the San Luis Valley of southern Colorado. The Food Bank Network worked diligently to provide a stable presence for households struggling with the various crises arising from the pandemic. Substantial funding was expended on cleaning supplies and masks to further local public health safety goals. During the pandemic onset, their food supplies dwindled due to shortages from local donors and nationwide wholesale partners. Additional food was required to meet the increased demand for services and equipment and it was difficult to find funding for facilities to store the added food volume. This project will assist the Network to cover unexpected expenses and continue supplying nutritious foods to food-insecure residents. This will also lead to a decrease in medical costs, as food insecurity has significant impacts on health outcomes. It will allow the Network to continue their important mission of providing food to residents in the San Luis Valley, a rural region of 8,780 residents.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide immediate relief from the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic for La Puente Home, Inc., a non-profit that runs a soup kitchen in the San Luis Valley of southern Colorado. Prior to the onset of the pandemic, the kitchen served approximately 23,000 meals a year using dishes and silverware that were cleaned and sanitized between use. Meals were served in the kitchens cafeteria which seated 70 diners. Implementing COVID-19 protocols including the use of foam to-go containers, plastic water bottles and plastic silverware that allowed the kitchens visitors to take their meals with them presented a substantial cost. In addition, supply chain issues also increased the cost of the kitchens bulk ingredients. This project will help offset these unexpected costs and allow La Puente Home to continue serving meals to those in need in this rural community of 8,780 residents.

borrower_name: LUTHERAN HOSPITAL ASSOCIATION OF THE SAN LUIS VALLEY
funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to perform renovations to improve patient and staff conditions at the San Luis Valley Regional Medical Center operated by the Lutheran Hospital Association of the San Luis Valley in southern Colorado. The Regional Medical Center dates back 100 years and only offers significantly overcrowded, semi-private rooms with non-American Disability Act (ADA) compliant bathrooms for inpatient care. This leads to concerns regarding infection prevention, isolation of contagious pathogens, privacy and overall patient experience as well presenting challenges to staff attempting to care for these patients. This project will convert seven rooms, presently used for outpatient cardiopulmonary services, into flexible private suites, including two that will have negative-pressure heating, ventilation and air conditioning systems for enhanced infection control and isolation capabilities. All rooms will feature ADA-compliant bathrooms, LED lighting, air scrubbers and necessary technology updates for modern equipment and patient monitoring. It will also fund updates and new equipment for the nursing station that serves these rooms. Overall, this project will improve the level of care and pandemic resilience for this medical facility serving 8,780 rural residents while also alleviating the largest source of patient complaints about the current conditions.

funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to renovate and add to the medical facilities of the Southeast Colorado Hospital District located in Baca County in southeastern Colorado. The district was established in 1966 as a not-for-profit hospital and officially opened its doors in 1969 with 23 acute care beds. This project will include construction of a rehabilitation department, addition of an emergency entry waiting area and ambulance canopy vestibule, a central nurses station and receiving materials management addition to provide necessary support services. The patient care unit will be renovated to allow for single occupancy rooms with accessible bathrooms. An emergency department will increase patient capacity and increase the size of each patient treatment area, and add a separate, controlled public waiting area. The laboratory department will be renovated with modern equipment and a new blood draw room. This project will ensure quality medical care for the residents of this rural community for years to come.

borrower_name: NORTHWEST CONEJOS COUNTY FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT
funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a brush truck for the Northwest Conejos County Fire Protection District located in the San Luis Valley in Southern Colorado. The district provides fire protection services to 159 square miles of Conejos County and assists nearby fire districts when called upon. The district experienced a drastic increase in fire response expenses in 2021, presenting a challenge in operating expenses and making grant funds necessary for the purchase of this equipment. By purchasing a new brush truck to be housed in a nearby fire station, this project will improve fire response and resiliency for this rural community of 5,388 residents that experiences extremely dry conditions.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide immediate relief from the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic for the Delta County Memorial Hospital District, serving the rural county of Delta in western Colorado. The district lost more than $2.5 million in revenue in 2020 as a result of the pandemic. This project will reimburse a portion of those lost funds to ensure the 8,915 rural residents the district serves continue to have access to high-quality healthcare. USDA previously funded $615,600 and is now able to grant another $384,400 to help the district recover.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide immediate relief from the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic for the Delta County Memorial Hospital District, serving the rural county of Delta in western Colorado. The pandemic caused the district to lose more than $2.5 million in revenue in the latter half of 2020 compared to their approved budget. This project will reimburse a portion of those lost funds to ensure the 8,915 rural residents the district serves continue to have access to high-quality healthcare.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Other Services (except Public Administration) (81)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Colorado Community Revitalization Association Inc., dba Downtown Colorado Inc. (DCI), develop business-to-business, "Connections in the San Luis Valley." This project will expand each business capacity by synchronizing communications and online listings, enhance local business-to-business partnerships, and forge networks for resources to access capital and local expertise. Additionally, strategies for entrepreneurial start up, expansion, and training will be provided.

funding_code: RBCS DEVELOPMENT GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide technical assistance to determine the feasibility of creating a multi-stakeholder cooperative to own and operate the former Wildflower Caf & Store in Gardener, Colorado. Additionally, outreach will be conducted in the local community to share the feasibility study results and training in the cooperative business model. The study will also assist additional family farms and small businesses through improved market access and product sales.

funding_code: RURAL COOPERATIVE DEVELOPMENT GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Educational Services (61)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to bring focus to cooperative development in Colorado. Rocky Mountain Farmers Union Cooperative Development Center will provide technical assistance, training, education and other services to cooperatives. This project will primarily focus on improving the economic conditions and quality of life in rural areas.

funding_code: (WWA PROGRAM AREA) TAT GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide: 1) Process a community application for a CECorps project and use the AWWA PSS workshop process to evaluate and prioritize the needs of some select water utilities; 2) Identify and prepare a qualified volunteer team to conduct the engineering project; 3) Create an agreement between the volunteer team and Client detailing the background, scope, and schedule for engineering services to be provided; 4) Create an engineering report that satisfies the agreement after it undergoes review through independent CECorps engineers. Provide ad-hoc additional training, education, workshops, and resources through AWWA trainers or Sections: 5) Conduct a closeout to gather data, lessons learned, and write a success story on the work that the volunteers and training staff conducted.

funding_code: GUARANTEED B&I 3% FEE LOAN
naics_industry_sector: Accommodation and Food Services (72)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase the Eagle River Lodge in Eagle, Colorado. The hotel site is located on approximately 1.66 acres. It is a three-story building with an area of 23,124 square feet containing 60 guest rooms, a dedicated breakfast room, fitness room, indoor swimming pool, business center and guest laundry. This project will create two jobs and save seven jobs.

borrower_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY VAIL VALLEY, INC
funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase an existing building to serve as the new location for Habitat for Humanity (HFH) Vail Valleys ReStore, a donation-supported thrift store operating in the Rocky Mountains of Western Colorado. Presently HFHs ReStore is located in Eagle, in a rented 3,500-square-foot facility too small to properly display goods for sale. The limited space also necessitates HFH renting on-site storage containers for donated items that cannot fit within the store. Additionally, the facility is in need of repairs and renovations that would hinder the facilitys operation. This project will purchase an approximately 16,000-square-foot facility that is more modern, includes a proper showroom and provides HFH with a larger, more visible presence in the community that solves their current capacity issues. The purchase will replace the variable costs of facility and storage rental with one fixed cost of repaying the loan. This also removes the need for HFH to disrupt operations with renovations to their current facility. All in all, this project will provide HFH with a better-suited building for their ReStore, and allow them to put more money towards their vital mission of improving affordable housing in its community.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to develop a business plan and feasibility study for rural Fremont County, Colorado, including Caon City and Florence. This will include creating a platform to seek out and recruit industry professionals who can provide custom designed training programs. Prospective areas identified are general construction techniques, plumbing, electrical, welding, landscaping, and other non-construction related trades. The program will improve opportunities for both employees and employers by removing obstacles inherent to these trades and allow for increased business in the county.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services (54)
naics_description: MANAGEMENT, SCIENTIFIC, AND TECHNICAL CONSULTING SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide additional financing to assist Grand Enterprise Initiative (GEI) in building strong small communities nurturing entrepreneurs by offering free business management coaching. This involves referrals to local or regional resources and a direct, hands-on approach for clients. The Coronavirus Pandemic and the East Troublesome Fire, which destroyed 300 homes and 200 buildings in October 2020, created additional needs for businesses in the area. Over the last 10 years, GEI assisted 478 clients, created 137 new businesses and 245 new jobs in Grand and Jackson Counties. This new funding will allow for an additional 13 jobs to be created over the next three years.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide immediate relief from the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic for the Huerfano County Hospital District in southern Colorado. Huerfano County residents face significant challenges in dealing with COVID-19 including a significant lack of resources and transportation that make accessing vaccines and testing difficult. This project will purchase and equip a mobile vaccine clinic to help reach underserved community members and educate those with vaccine hesitancy concerns. Thegoal is to provide testing, education, and vaccination to all vaccine-eligible residents of Huerfano County at least a two-year period. District providers will staff the van and travel throughout the county to ensure COVID-19 cases decrease through education, routine testing, and administration of vaccines and booster shots. The mobile clinic could be converted to assist with future pandemics. This project will help the 6,711 residents of one of Colorados counties hardest hit by the pandemic, to recover and be more resilient against future pandemics.

funding_code: RCDI RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to fund the development of planning documents for the Ute Mountain Ute Tribe in southwestern Colorado. In 2017, the tribe developed their Comprehensive Master Plan for Housing and Open Spaces. This plan has resulted in over $50 million in new grants to go towards wellness, housing, landscape and connections projects. However, due to the COVID-19 pandemic and changing economic circumstances, the plan is need of an update. This project will provide funds to Region 9 Economic Development District of Southwest Colorado Inc. to act as intermediary and assist the Tribe in these updates by providing project oversight and facilitation. Region 9 has set specific benchmarks to measure the success of the program, including minimum numbers of town meetings, focus groups and people trained. This project will ensure that momentum from the 2017 plan is not lost, and the Tribe is able to make long-lasting and significant improvements that increase the 932 Tribal residents social and economic well-being.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide additional funding to repair Prospect Mountain Water Companys (PMWC) system for the town of Estes Park in northern Colorado. PMWC is a privately-owned water company that distributes water from Estes Park to its customers. In addition, there is insufficient storage capacity, insufficient flow to provide for fire protection, and an insufficient number of hydrants to protect the community. This project will replace the distribution systems piping as well as the interconnect to Estes Parks system, a new booster station, storage tank and pressure relief vault. Due to current economic conditions, costs associated with this project have increased, necessitating the need for this additional funding. Once completed, this project will ensure the 3,189 rural resident of Estes Park continue to have access to both clean, reliable drinking water and fire protection.

funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a facility for Trinidad Ambulance District located in Las Animas County in southeastern Colorado. The Districts current facility is too small to house the fleets vehicles and there is insufficient parking to conduct training or education programs at the facility. There is no unused space on the lot to allow for any expansion to address these issues. Additionally, its geographical location in relation to the dispatch broadcast tower creates radio reception issues, resulting in delays to their response to emergencies as dispatchers have to call personal cell phones to get through. This project will help purchase a new facility located closer to the dispatch tower and population center of the City of Trinidad, remedying reception issues and reducing response times to emergencies. Both the proposed facility and the lot it sits on are also almost triple the size of their current property, allowing for the housing of all of the Districts vehicles and future expansion if necessary. In summary, this project will ensure the 15,507 residents of this rural Colorado County have access to reliable emergency response for years to come.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to stimulate and accelerate a rural bio-based economic development in Sterling, Colorado. The project will increase the ability of regional wheat straw and transportation businesses to provide their services and goods to green technology companies that produce bioenergy and other bio-based products. The rating will help to attract new markets to Sterling that buy the products and services provided by local businesses and the farming sector; creating 12 new jobs in the community.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to update the heating, ventilation and air conditioning system of the clinic and ambulance building in Mineral County in southwest Colorado. Currently this essential community building is served by an inefficient, dated system that results in constant comfort complaints, with heating issues on the south side of the building and cooling issues on the north side. This also saddles the county with high energy bills and usage. This project will replace the system with high-efficiency split system heat pumps and fan coil units while using existing ducting. It will also include fixing broken windows, degraded flashing and door gaps to minimize energy loss. To summarize, this project will improve the comfort in a crucial community building that has seen increased use and demand as a result of COVID-19.

funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to improve and modernize the water treatment facility for Montezuma County in southwestern Colorado. Currently, the system can handle four million gallons per day. Some of the equipment dates back to the construction of the facility in 1985 and expansions in 1999 and 2009 that increased capacity to its current level, though it is insufficient for the current population and will only become more so given the projected population increase in the area. Several health and sanitary concerns exist with the current facility, including possible contamination of filtered water. This project will expand the plants capacity to six million gallons per day with possible future expansion to eight million gallons. It will install new water pumps, a new redundant treatment train including pretreatment, filtration and disinfection, new chlorine storage that allows for significantly reduced chlorine deliveries, a new, more robust pH adjustment system and new finished water pumps to increase capacity and conveyance.

funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to improve and modernize the water treatment facility for Montezuma County in southwestern Colorado. Currently, the system can handle four million gallons per day. Some of the equipment dates back to the construction of the facility in 1985 and expansions in 1999 and 2009 that increased capacity to its current level, though it is insufficient for the current population and will only become more so given the projected population increase in the area. Several health and sanitary concerns exist with the current facility, including possible contamination of filtered water. This project will expand the plants capacity to six million gallons per day with possible future expansion to eight million gallons. It will install new water pumps, a new redundant treatment train including pretreatment, filtration and disinfection, new chlorine storage that allows for significantly reduced chlorine deliveries, a new, more robust pH adjustment system and new finished water pumps to increase capacity and conveyance.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MAND RENEW ENERGY SYSTEMS LOANS GUAR
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install a 9.97MW Solar PV energy generation system. Ash Mesa Solar LLC is a newly formed entity for this project and will sell the energy generated to a business near the location. The local utility will purchase the energy if the contract is not renewed. The system is estimated to generate 20,104MW annually, which is enough to power over 1,850 homes.

funding_code: VALUE-ADDED PRODUCER DEVELOPMENT GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Billy Goat Hop Farm LLC in Montrose, Colorado, expand their variations of T90 Hop Pellets. The funds will partially go towards purchasing a portion of the needed hops from the smaller/local farmers. They will create one job & assist local farms by purchasing locally. The new pellets will reduce the carbon footprint due to the current availability of these variations only being available from businesses in the Pacific Northwest.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide immediate relief from the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic for the rural town of Delta in western Colorado. By providing funding for the clinic to purchase new equipment, this investment will increase the communitys access to COVID-19 testing, vaccines and treatment. Delta is a medically underserved, low-income community with isolated populations and limited access to healthcare. These conditions continue to create inequities in disease prevalence and health outcomes. Olathe Community Clinic is a non-profit organization that is opening a new 18,500 sq. ft. integrated care facility that will feature medical exam rooms, dental operatories, therapy rooms, an in-house pharmacy and a Convenient Care Center. The care center can be sealed off from the rest of the facility and features ultraviolet air filtration and negative air pressure systems. This will allow for mass testing, treatment and vaccinations for COVID-19 or future pandemic events. This project will help purchase the necessary equipment for the clinic to operate and ensure the communitys 8,915 rural residents have access to more resilient, inclusive healthcare going forward.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to repair and modernize the waste water treatment system for the Town of Naturita in western Colorado. The system presently consists of approximately 30,000 linear feet of sewer pipe. Video reviews have determined that roughly 10,000 linear feet is in need of replacement, though a third of the lines remain to be videoed. The lagoon system treatment facility is under a Cease and Desist Order from the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment (CDPHE) for multiple effluent level violations and the ponds are seeping beyond the CDPHE limit. This project will complete the video review of the transmission lines and perform targeted repairs to lines in need of replacement. The lagoons will be repaired and one lagoon will be converted into two separate treatment basins, with each basin having two cells. This separation will allow for the installation of additional equipment including polishing reactors and up-flow sand filters, ensuring the plant can meet the effluent limits. This project will provide the Town of Naturitas 546 rural residents with reliable, environmentally-friendly waste water treatment for years to come.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
naics_description: ASSISTED LIVING FACILITIES FOR THE ELDERLY
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help offset the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic for Eben Ezer Lutheran Care Center located in Morgan County in northeastern Colorado. Comparing pandemic-era revenue to previous years, the Care Center has suffered lost revenues of over $5.5 million. This has been due to pausing long-term admissions and retaining as much staff as possible. This project will reimburse the Care Center for a portion of lost revenues, helping to ensure that the 5,463 residents of this rural community continue to have access to high-quality healthcare.

funding_code: PILOT BROADBAND GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to deploy a fiber-to-the-home network. This network will connect 3,577 people, 148 businesses, one school, and 765 farms to high-speed internet in the Colorado counties of Delta, Montrose and Gunnison. Delta-Montrose Electrical Association will make high-speed internet affordable by participation in the FCCs Affordable Connectivity and Lifeline programs to provide low-cost internet to its service area. This project will also serve the socially vulnerable community of Delta County.

Eastern Slope Rural Telephone Association Inc. will make high-speed internet affordable by participating in the FCCs Affordable Connectivity Program.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
naics_description: OFFICES OF PHYSICIANS, MENTAL HEALTH SPECIALISTS
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used provide immediate relief from the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic for residents in six counties of Southeastern Colorado. This project will purchase personal protective equipment (PPE), cleaning supplies and furniture for an outdoor waiting room. The PPE and cleaning supplies are critical to their ability to maintain trust with their community, especially those who are unhoused and those who are intoxicated or in acute mental health crisis. It will allow them to continue providing necessary health care services and assisting them in becoming vaccinated against COVID-19. The outdoor furniture will expand the waiting areas to the outdoor patios, allowing patients to social distance and have fresh air while waiting for appointments. In summary, this project will ensure Southeast Mental Health Services can more resiliently provide mental and behavioral health care to the 48,890 rural residents within their service area, during this and future pandemics.

program: SEARCH - Special Evaluation Assistance for Rural Communities and Households Grant (WEP)
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) SEARCH GRANTS WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to fund initial work to improve the water treatment facility for the town of Cheraw, in southeastern Colorado. The town is currently under an Enforcement Order from the Colorado Department of Public Health & Environment for being out of compliance with radium limits. The towns water filters remove insufficient amounts of this radioactive metal. This project will fund a Preliminary Engineering Report and Environmental Review for retrofitting the existing plant with better filtration. Because the surrounding communities are also under similar Enforcement Orders, the Town returning to compliance and having their Order lifted will allow consolidation with six neighboring water associations that do not feasibly have the ability to return to compliance by assuming ownership of their wells and providing finished water from the towns upgraded plant. In summary, this project will fund the crucial first step to ensuring the 252 rural residents of Cheraw have clean drinking water, and eventually provide it to the surrounding communities as well.

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide additional funding to construct a wastewater treatment facility for the Lazy Glen Homeowners Association located in the Rocky Mountains of Colorado. Lazy Glen is currently served by a lagoon that has neither the capacity nor redundancy necessary. It also lies within the 100-year floodplain and does not meet current permitted discharge limits. This project will construct such a facility without utilizing discharges into the lagoon, providing a more environmentally-friendly option and bringing the community back into compliance with discharge limits. In summary, this project will ensure the rural residents of the Lazy Glen community have reliable, safe and compliant wastewater service for years to come. In summary, this project will ensure the rural residents of the Lazy Glen community have reliable, safe and compliant wastewater service for years to come.

borrower_name: EASTERN RIO BLANCO HEALTH SERVICE DISTRICT
funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide immediate relief from the COVID-19 pandemic for Rio Blanco County in northwestern Colorado. It will do so by funding the telehealth program of the Eastern Rio Blanco Health Service District. The district serves the entire county of 2,475 rural residents, however, the roads used to access the Medical Center are not all paved and are not always accessible. These difficulties along with the increased awareness of the benefits of telehealth brought on by the COVID-19 pandemic have spurred the district to upgrade their IT network to accommodate a a telehealth network. This project will fund the development and patient education around the telehealth network. Having telehealth as an option will increase patient access to services, and by giving patients the option to stay home and still receive medical care, it will help prevent the spread of COVID-19 and other infectious diseases. In short, this project will ensure the residents of Rio Blanco County have access to medical services even in inclement weather or when travelling to the clinic could present a transmission risk.

program: SEARCH - Special Evaluation Assistance for Rural Communities and Households Grant (WEP)
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) SEARCH GRANTS W&W
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to fund a Preliminary Engineering Report and Environmental Report for the town of Saguache in southern Colorado. The towns water system uses chlorine gas to treat water supplied to approximately 500 residents and 30 businesses through unmetered, flat-rate connections. This project will fund reports necessary to address needed improvements to the towns water and wastewater facility, including installing meters at all taps, replacement of aging valves, and updating both the water and wastewater treatment plants to use liquid chlorine. This project will fund the first step in the process to modernize the water and wastewater systems for the 485 rural residents of Saguache to provide clean drinking water now and into the future.

funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Construction (23)
naics_description: OTHER FOUNDATION, STRUCTURE, AND BUILDING EXTERIOR CONTRACTORS
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install a 7.98kW PV Solar Roof Mounted Grid Tied system for Colorado Custom Fire Pits LLC in Placerville, Colorado. The system will produce 12,601kW annually, a savings of $1,697.35 annually.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
borrower_name: DALTON MTN GEAR DBA JAGGED EDGE MTN GEAR
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Retail Trade (44-45)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install a 7.6kW PV Solar Roof Mounted, Grid Tied system for Jagged Edge Mountain Gear in Telluride, Colorado. The independent, family-owned specialty outdoor retail storehas been in operation for over 15 years.The system will produce 11,745kW annually, a savings of $1,308.01 annually.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Wholesale Trade (42)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide immediate relief from the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic for Uncompahgre Combined Clinics serving the community of Norwood in southwestern Colorado. The pandemic has seen the Clinics equipment experience high demand. This, along with the need for specific testing and triage procedures for patients has highlighted the need for new and replaced equipment, such as room dividers and personal protective equipment. This project will fund equipment purchases to help the clinic with increased patient encounters and increased time with patients to ensure the 518 residents of this rural community have access to local healthcare without having to travel 60 miles to the nearest alternative.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Information (51)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to improve sound mitigation in the multipurpose room of the Lone Cone Library, serving the town of Norwood and the surrounding community in southwestern Colorado. The librarys new facility had been open less than a year when the COVID-19 pandemic hit, and its multipurpose room has seen high demand for hosting hybrid-style meetings. Unfortunately, the room was designed without this use as a primary consideration, and the hard surfaces of the space mean online participants in these meetings cannot hear what is being discussed. In order to facilitate safe and effective hybrid meetings, this project will renovate the multipurpose room, installing tectum panels to improve sound mitigation and modifying the existing structure to accommodate the panels. In summary, this project will help ensure the 518 residents of this rural community have access to a space that can safely host hybrid meetings and provide more resiliency to the area in the future.

program: SEARCH - Special Evaluation Assistance for Rural Communities and Households Grant (WEP)
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) SEARCH GRANTS WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to fund the necessary first steps for the town of Ovid in northeastern Colorado to upgrade its drinking water system. The towns water distribution system dates back to 1927 and though a portion was replaced in 2006, the rest of the system is still serviced by nearly 100-year-old transmission lines. The towns system is currently comprised of a single operational well equipped with a 40-year-old pump that is beyond its useful life. The eventual failure of this pump will force the Town to use their manually-operated backup well, only capable of an inadequate 65 gallons per minute at most. As of September 2021, the Towns disinfection system has failed as well, forcing them to use a temporary connection and borrowed pump. This project will fund the crucial first step of a Preliminary Engineering Report and Environmental Report so that the town can identify affordable alternatives to upgrade their water distribution system and ensure the 318 residents of this rural community have continued access to high quality drinking water.

naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Morwai Dairy, LLC in Hudson, Colorado develop a feasibility study. The study will help determine if they should diversify their operations to implement a slaughter and meat processing facility at their existing dairy, to process their culled cattle that are being sold. Currently they are milking 3,000 dairy cows daily and all culled cows are sent to a sale barn or sold to processors. The project is expected to create 15 jobs.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to rehabilitate the sanitary sewer system in the town of Gilcrest, located in northern Colorado. The Town owns and operates its own sanitary sewer system, however, the oldest portions date all the way back to pre-1970. Following a comprehensive survey performed in 2019 to determine the systems condition, it was found that significant portions are in need of repair or replacement, including the lagoon liners, both lift stations and over one third of the transmission lines. This project will install new equipment in the treatment plant to replace items that are failing along with ensuring regulatory compliance with current discharge limits. It will also repair or replace 76 maintenance holes, almost 12,000 linear feet of transmission lines and both lift stations. Sand ballasting will be installed to protect the lagoon liners from high groundwater that presents constant maintenance issues and potential groundwater contamination. In summary, this project will bring the towns wastewater system into the modern age, ensuring environmental compliance and adequate service for the 1,034 rural residents covered by the system.

funding_code: REAP IRA TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Construction (23)

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct a water treatment plant for the town of Springfield in southeast Colorado. Currently, the town operates nine wells to supply water, all with water quality issues of varying severity, such as elevated radium, uranium or nitrate levels above the maximum contaminant limit. Though the cast-iron distribution lines originally installed in 1954 have seen upgrades to polyvinyl choloride (PVC) between 1981 and 2000, approximately 3,600 linear feet of cast-iron lines still remain. This project will construct a water treatment plant, allowing water from the best-producing wells to be brought to a central location for chlorination and radium and uranium treatment via filters. It will also allow for future water treatment expansion to meet increasing demand. The plant will reduce costs by centralizing water treatment and reducing the entry points requiring sampling and monitoring. The project will further reduce operating costs by replacing the remaining cast-iron pipe with PVC to reduce the occurrence of breaks in the line. In conclusion, this project will ensure the 1,451 rural residents served by this project will have access to potable water supplied by a new plant that is less expensive for the town to operate.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct a new wastewater treatment plant for the town of Wiley in Southeastern Colorado. The current lagoon system is unlined, unaerated and has a capped discharge pipe resulting in all effluent discharge occurring into groundwater via seepage and likely at rates higher than regulation allows. This project will construct a new, complete evaporative pond system consisting of three appropriately sized pond and all associated yard piping. Capacity will also be reduced from 50,000 gallons per day (gpd) to 41,000 gpd to decrease capital costs and footprint for the project, as the districts service area is not expected to substantially increase in the future. All wastewater from the town will flow directly into these ponds. Each pond will be lined with synthetic liners to limit seepage to acceptable levels under regulation. When completed, the new system will be non-discharging and completely evaporative, eliminating the uncontrolled discharge of untreated wastewater and ensuring reliable wastewater treatment for the 405 residents of this rural town.

funding_code: INDIGENOUS ANIMALS GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide capital for a cooperative agreement with the Oweesta Corporation to administer the Indigenous Animals Grant (IAG) program designed to serve tribal meat and poultry processors. Oweesta will manage grant funds by focusing on selecting, disbursing, monitoring, and reporting award progress. Grant awards will support indigenous processing methods for indigenous animals, and increase tribal supply chain resiliency and food security in Indian Country. This program will also promote competition and increase tribal food security, as well as give more and better options to producers by increasing meat and poultry processing capacity. IAG program is part of USDAs initiative to strengthen critical supply chains and food systems.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help the Gunnison Country Food Pantry located in the Rocky Mountains of Colorado recover from the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic. During the pandemic, the pantry has seen an estimated 66 percent increase in demand for its services. Inflation and expiring special federal food assistance funds mean the pantry anticipates this demand will continue. This project will provide funds to help cover expenses such as insurance, facility expenses and direct project costs for three years. The pantry provides critical food supplies, and this project will ensure it is able to continue to help the 5,854 rural residents within its service area recover from the COVID-19 pandemic.

naics_description: RESCUE AND AMBULANCE SERVICE - EQUIPMENT BUILDING
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to furnish equipment for the new Emergency Medical Services (EMS) building in Gunnison County in southwestern Colorado. The county is presently constructing an EMS facility to better serve its 5,089 rural residents that a local health care provider will operate. The project will also include necessary equipment for the completed facility such as laptop computers, radios, medical storage and dispensing equipment. This project will ensure Gunnison County has an updated facility to provide essential medical services and build resilience against future pandemics.

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assess water system improvement options for the town of Idledale in northern Colorado. The system is fed by three raw water wells capable only of producing approximately 19 gallons per minute (gpm) compared to the 33 gpm needed insufficient to meet demand. This project will commission a Preliminary Engineering Report and Environmental Report to identify viable options to expand the systems capacity. This necessary first step will start the process of ensuring the 223 residents of this rural community have access to a sufficient water supply.

funding_code: FY22 CONGRESSIONALLY DIRECTED SPENDING
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to remodel the food preparation area for Fort Lewis College in Durango, located in southwestern Colorado. The colleges existing facility does not meet their operational needs, as it does not provide the appropriate food storage, a designated prep area, and is not Americans with Disabilities Act accessible. This project will include a grocery-style pantry that includes a food prep area and a resource hub. In addition to providing free healthy groceries, the center will also offer support resource navigation services such as the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program registration. In the past year, the college experienced a 233 percent increase in usage and a 427 percent increase in food distribution. The proposed design will allow the college to maximize food storage capacity, and provide areas for community-building and interaction. Additionally, the center has been intentionally placed near two established organizations that support Native American and Latino populations. Given that Fort Lewis College is primarily a Native American-serving non-tribal institution with more than 50 percent students of color, the project will help reduce existing inequalities and create a new model for addressing food security and rural agricultural development in the region. This project will ensure the 16,501 Durango rural area residents have access to the essential food pantry that can accommodate the growing demand for its services.

funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to update the wastewater system for the town of Palisade in western Colorado. Since approximately 2013, the towns wastewater has exceeded its influent organic load capacity allowed per their current Colorado Department of Public Health & Environment (CDPHE) permit. This discharge permit expired on September 30, 2018 and is currently on administrative extension until CDPHE revisits the permit, after which, it is anticipated more stringent effluent limits will be established which could only be attained using a mechanical treatment plant. This project will consist of abandoning their lagoons while installing a new sewer transfer line and lift station to transport wastewater to nearby Clifton Sanitation District using existing easements and rights-of-way. This will help the town reduce their operating costs and avoid having to install its own mechanical wastewater treatment facility. When complete, this project will ensure the 2,681 residents of this rural Colorado town have reliable wastewater service without the financial burden of their own dedicated treatment plant while still ensuring capacity for anticipated future growth.

funding_code: FY22 CONGRESSIONALLY DIRECTED SPENDING
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct a new courthouse for Moffat County in northwestern Colorado through Congressionally directed spending. The existing courthouse was built in 1917 and is no longer a usable structure. This project will fund the renovation of a vacant 80,000 square foot building in Craig, Colorado that previously housed a retail store. The completed facility will provide a home for both the new courthouse and the primary offices for the county, eliminating the need for six separate departmental locations. This project will allow for easier access to government services for the 13,795 residents of this rural Colorado county.

funding_code: FY22 CONGRESSIONALLY DIRECTED SPENDING
naics_industry_sector: Educational Services (61)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to build a school for the Ute Mountain Ute Tribe in southwestern Colorado through Congressionally Directed Spending. The existing school is the former Ute Mountain Ute K-12 Education Department building and with only 3 classrooms for K-12, it is not large enough to accommodate future growth. This project will relocate grades K-5 to a permanent facility just south of the existing location. It will consist of the construction of a 21,000 square foot charter school. The facility will include six classrooms, administrative spaces, multipurpose lunchroom, library, gym and other ancillary support spaces. When completed, this project will improve access to education for the 1,087 rural residents of this Native American tribe.

funding_code: FY22 CONGRESSIONALLY DIRECTED SPENDING
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to renovate the courthouse for Montrose County in western Colorado through congressionally directed spending. The building serves as a key anchor for downtown activity in Montrose, however, the county is currently only using the garden level and first floor of this four-floor structure; the other floors have fallen into disrepair and are not suitable for county operations. This project will help fund the renovation per a design that addresses everything from the foundation, floor slab, walls, electrical, plumbing and the heating, ventilation, and air conditioning unit. Throughout the design process, the architects met with the various county departments to understand the space utilization requirements and projected future growth and space needs. The renovated facility will house elected officials offices for the Board of County Commissioners, Assessor, and Treasurer and other county functions including management, legal, and Geographic Information Systems, and allow for future growth in these departments. This project will help to preserve a vital piece of local history and allow easy access for the 19,132 rural area residents to continue to use the courthouse as the civic hub for county business.

funding_code: CY 2022  REGULAR GRANTS DIV N
naics_industry_sector: Wholesale Trade (42)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase medical equipment for the Basin Clinic in the town of Naturita in Western Colorado. The Basin Clinic has several pieces of outdated equipment in need of replacement, including a defibrillator, white blood cell analyzer, urine analyzer and i-STAT 1 machines. This project will purchase new equipment for the Clinic to replace the pieces in need of replacement and ensure the 1,702 residents of this distressed community have access to resilient healthcare now and in the future.

program: Meat and Poultry Intermediary Lending Program (MPILP)
funding_code: MEAT & POULTRY IRP GRANTS - ARPA
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help capitalize a revolving loan fund. The Morgan County Economic Development Corporation (MCEDC) will initially use the loan funds to assist with expansion of a livestock producer processing plant that markets a quarter, one-half, and whole beef directly to consumers, as well as providing value added wholesale and retail meat products. The facility capacity is projecting to increase from 24 to 100 head of beef per week, and add a curing/smoking facility. The expansion anticipates creating 25-30 new jobs. MCEDC will use revolving loan funds to assist start-up and current businesses with processing, storage, packaging, and transportation in Morgan County Colorado.
