funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to improve the wastewater treatment facilities for the city of Monte Vista in southern Colorado. Currently the city owns and operates twolagoon wastewater treatment plants: the Henderson Wastewater Treatment Plant (HWWTP), and the Veterans Wastewater Treatment Plant (VWWTP). A notice of violation has been issued by the state for failure to meet multiple effluent limits. In addition, inflow and infiltration are consistent issues with the system. This project will overhaul the current system, consolidating all of the citys municipal flows to the Henderson plant, converting to an activating sludge plant and improving the overall collection system. This will involve the construction of a new lift station and new force main, along with multiple upgrades the Henderson plant including flow monitoring, activated sludge treatment and UV disinfection. The collection system improvements will complete the necessary work identified in the citys capital improvement plan including adding 29 new manholes and replacing over 7,000 linear feet of pipe. When completed, this project will bring the city back into compliance with regulation by providing its 4,444 rural residents with a cleaner, more modern wastewater treatment system.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to rehabilitate the wastewater treatment plant for the community of Galeton in Northern Colorado. Currently, Galetons lagoon system does not comply with Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment (CDPHE) requirements to have a settling pond for suspended solids removal. The system also has consistent problems meeting discharge permit limits. This has resulted in a Cease and Desist Order and only achieving compliance with limits roughly 12 percent of the time from 2017 to present. This project will include improvements comprised of lagoon system rehabilitation with additional treatment units including a polishing reactor, a moving bed bio-reactor, and an ultraviolet disinfection system. The existing lagoons will be regraded and relined with synthetic liners to meet CDPHE design criteria for seepage. The proposed plants will maintain the existing permitted flow of 18,500 gpd. The proposed plant will be capable of meeting all discharge permit effluent limits for all months of the year. The existing effluent outfall will be utilized and will not be altered. Once complete, this project will ensure the 123 residents of this rural community have wastewater treatment that complies with all applicable regulations.

funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct a pipeline and lift station to connect the city of Fort Lupton in northern Colorado to the nearby North Metro Wastewater Treatment Plant (NMWWTP) currently operating at 20 percent capacity. Given its small size, the city struggles financially to support larger infrastructure projects. This construction on the citys wastewater-treatment site to convey flows to the NMWWTP is the most cost-effective solution identified. The city of Fort Lupton City also has been issued a compliance schedule by the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment. The project will ensure this rural citys 5,102 residents have reliable wastewater treatment compliant with all regulations without having to pay costly maintenance on its own plant.

It then will be used and moved over to their new facility once construction is complete. The Board of Trustees of Lincoln Community Hospital also know as Lincoln Community Hospital is in the planning stages of constructing a new hospital and nursing home facility in Hugo, Colorado. Equipment purchased will be for several departments including: the clinic, the IT Department, maintenance equipment, hospital equipment, equipment for the long term care unit, therapy equipment, lab equipment, and equipment for the radiology and surgery departments.

funding_code: FY22 CONGRESSIONALLY DIRECTED SPENDING
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to complete construction on a family care clinic in the town of Haxtun in northeastern Colorado through Congressionally Directed Spending. Currently, the community hospital is the sole facility that serves the surrounding community for both emergency and urgent care, but also routine doctors visits and physical therapy. This project is constructing a "main street clinic" for family care, physical therapy and includes a retail pharmacy thus offloading over 10,000 annual visits from the hospital campus. These Congressionally Directed funds will complete the final phase of the project including wrapping and roofing the building, interior finishes, and furnishings and equipment. By separating these functions from the main campus, this project ensures preparedness for future pandemics by reducing foot traffic at the hospital and gives the 3,401 residents of this rural community more convenient access to routine medical services.
